Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.PresentationLayer.ClassDiagram

Class ClassEditorUI

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.PresentationLayer.ClassDiagram.ClassEditorUI
public class ClassEditorUI extends Object

Class Editor UI

The ClassEditorUI class represents the user interface for editing UML class details in the UML Class Diagram Editor. It provides functionality to manage class attributes, methods, and parameters, as well as apply changes to the UML model.

This class manages various UI components such as text fields, combo boxes, and buttons, and interacts with the ClassEditorManager to facilitate the creation and modification of UML class elements. It also supports custom data types for attributes and methods and allows users to add parameters to methods.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Constructor Details

    • ClassEditorUI

      public ClassEditorUI()
      Default constructor required by FXMLLoader.

      This constructor initializes the ClassEditorManager and will be injected with the ClassDiagramManager later through the setClassDiagramManager() method.

  • Method Details

    • setClassDiagramManager

      public void setClassDiagramManager(ClassDiagramManager manager)
      Sets the ClassDiagramManager reference and updates the ClassEditorManager.

      This method allows the ClassEditorUI to interact with the ClassDiagramManager instance, which is responsible for managing the UML diagram. The ClassEditorManager is also updated with the reference to allow consistent diagram editing.

      Parameters:
      manager - The ClassDiagramManager instance to be set.

    • setClassBox

      public void setClassBox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox classBox, UMLClassBox umlClassBox)
      Sets the class box and populates the editor fields with existing class data.

      This method is called when an existing UML class is selected. It populates the class editor with the current name, attributes, and methods of the UML class.

      Parameters:
      classBox - The VBox representing the class in the UI.
      umlClassBox - The UMLClassBox model object containing class data.

    • applyHoverEffect

      public void applyHoverEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a hover effect to a button when the mouse enters.

      This method changes the style of the button to provide visual feedback to the user when they hover over it.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered when the mouse enters the button area.

    • applyHoverEffect1

      public void applyHoverEffect1(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a hover effect to a button when the mouse enters.

      This method changes the style of the button to provide visual feedback to the user when they hover over it.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered when the mouse enters the button area.

    • removeHoverEffect

      public void removeHoverEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Removes the hover effect from a button when the mouse exits.

      This method resets the style of the button to its default state when the mouse is no longer hovering over it.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered when the mouse exits the button area.

    • removeHoverEffect1

    • applyClickEffect

      public void applyClickEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a click effect to a button when it is clicked.

      This method changes the style of the button to provide visual feedback to the user when they click on it.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered when the button is clicked.

    • getEditorNode

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getEditorNode()
      Provides access to the root node of ClassEditorUI.

      This method returns the root VBox node, which can be used to integrate the class editor UI into other parts of the application.

      Returns:
      The root VBox of ClassEditorUI.
